params.proposalId: id of the proposal to close the vote on and send the voting result to governance
id of the proposal to retrieve

getProposalsVoteConfigurationIds(uint256.details: This is mainly used to get a list of proposals that require automation in some step of the proposal live cycle.

params.size: length of proposal ids to ask for.
params.skip: number of proposal ids to skip. from latest in the list of proposal ids with voting configuration

params.proposalId: id of the proposal to retrieve the vote from
params.user: address of the user that voted

returns._0: the vote (support and voting power) emitted

startProposalVote(uint256).details: this method can be called by anyone, requiring that the appropriate conditions are met. basically that the proper roots have been registered. It can also be called internally when the bridged message is received and the the required roots have been registered

params.proposalId: id of the proposal to start the vote on.

returns._0: the id of the proposal that had the vote started on.

submitVote(uint256,bool,(address,uint128.details: A vote does not need to use all the tokens allowed, can be a subset

params.proposalId: id of the proposal on which the vote will be cast
params.support: boolean indicating if the vote is in favor or against the proposal
params.votingBalanceProofs: list of objects containing the information necessary to vote using the tokens allowed on the voting strategy.

params.proofOfRepresentation: proof that can validate that msg.sender is the voter representative
params.support: boolean, true = vote for, false = vote against

params.proofOfRepresentation: proof that can validate that msg.sender is the voter representative
params.signatureParams: object containing the necessary signature parameters

params.r: r part of the voter signature
params.s: s part of the voter signature
params.support: boolean, true = vote for, false = vote against
params.v: v part of the voter signature
